Advanced/1 Connection Status.title: Connection Status
Advanced/1 Connection Status.description: CometChat SDK provides you with a mechanism to get real-time status of the connection to CometChat web-socket servers. To achieve this you need to use the ConnectionListener class provided by the CometChat SDK

Advanced/index.title: Advanced
Advanced/index.description: This section helps you to know about the Connection Listeners.

Authentication/Login Listeners.title: Login Listeners
Authentication/Login Listeners.description: The CometChat SDK provides you with real-time updates for the login and logout events. This can be achieved using the LoginListener class provided. LoginListener consists of 4 events that can be triggered. These are as follows:

Calling v3/Default Calling.title: Default Calling
Calling v3/Default Calling.description: This section will provide information on how a complete calling workflow can be set up using CometChat. We've built the complete workflow to help your users make calls, receive calls as well as accept/reject calls.

Calling v3/index.title: Calling v3
Calling v3/index.description: Calling is a core feature of CometChat.

Calling v3/Recording.title: Recording
Calling v3/Recording.description: This section will guide you to implement call recording feature for the voice and video calls.

Calling v3/Video view customisation.title: Video view customisation
Calling v3/Video view customisation.description: This section will guide you to customise the main video container.

Groups/Ban Or Kick Member from a Group.id: Groups/Ban Or Kick Member from a Group
Groups/Ban Or Kick Member from a Group.title: Ban/Kick Member from a Group
Groups/Ban Or Kick Member from a Group.description: There are certain actions that can be performed on the group members:

Groups/Change Member Scope.title: Change Member Scope
Groups/Change Member Scope.description: Change Scope of a Group Member

Groups/Create a Group.title: Create a Group
Groups/Create a Group.description: In other words, as a logged-in user, how do I create a public, private or password-protected group?

Groups/index.title: Groups
Groups/index.description: Groups help your users to converse together in a single space. You can have three types of groups- private, public and password protected.

Groups/Join a Group.title: Join a Group
Groups/Join a Group.description: In order to start participating in group conversations, you will have to join a group. You can do so using the joinGroup() method.

Groups/Leave a Group.title: Leave a Group
Groups/Leave a Group.description: In order to stop receiving updates and messages for any particular joined group, you will have to leave the group using the leaveGroup() method.

Groups/Retrieve Group Members.title: Retrieve Group Members
Groups/Retrieve Group Members.description: Retrieve the List of Group Members

Groups/Transfer Group Ownership.title: Transfer Group Ownership
Groups/Transfer Group Ownership.description: In other words, as a logged-in user, how do I transfer the ownership of any group if I am the owner of the group?

Groups/Update a Group.title: Update a Group
Groups/Update a Group.description: In other words, as a group owner, how can I update the group details?

Messaging/Additional Message Filtering.title: Additional Message Filtering
Messaging/Additional Message Filtering.description: The MessagesRequest class as you must be familiar with helps you to fetch messages based on the various parameters provided to it. This document will help you understand better the various options that are available using the MessagesRequest class.

Messaging/Delete a conversation.title: Delete a conversation
Messaging/Delete a conversation.description: In case you want to delete a conversation, you can use the deleteConversation() method.

Messaging/Delete a Message.title: Delete a Message
Messaging/Delete a Message.description: While deleting a message is straightforward, receiving events for deleted messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/Edit a Message.title: Edit a Message
Messaging/Edit a Message.description: While editing a message is straightforward, receiving events for edited messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/index.title: Messaging
Messaging/index.description: Messaging is one of the core features of CometChat. We've thoughtfully created methods to help you send, receive and fetch message history.

Messaging/Receive a Message.title: Receive Messages
Messaging/Receive a Message.description: Receiving messages with CometChat has two parts:

Messaging/Send a Message.title: Send a Message
Messaging/Send a Message.description: Using CometChat, you can send three types of messages:

Messaging/Threaded Messages.title: Threaded Messages
Messaging/Threaded Messages.description: Messages that are started from a particular message are called Threaded messages or simply threads.

Messaging/Transient Messages.title: Transient Messages
Messaging/Transient Messages.description: Transient messages are messages that are sent in real-time only and are not saved or tracked anywhere. The receiver of the message will only receive the message if he is online and these messages cannot be retrieved later.

Overview/index.title: Overview
Overview/index.description: This guide demonstrates how to add chat to a Flutter application. Before you begin, we strongly recommend you read the Key Concepts guide.

Overview/Message structure and hierarchy.title: Message structure and hierarchy
Overview/Message structure and hierarchy.description: The below diagram helps you better understand the various message categories and types that a CometChat message can belong to.

Overview/Rate Limits.title: Rate Limits
Overview/Rate Limits.description: CometChat Pro REST API Rate Limits

Resources/index.title: Resources
Resources/index.description: We have a number of resources that will help you while integrating CometChat in your app.

User-Presence.title: User Presence
User-Presence.description: User Presence helps us understand if a user is available to chat or not.

Users/Block Users.title: Block Users
Users/Block Users.description: In other words, as a logged-in user, how do I block a user from sending me messages?

Users/index.title: Users
Users/index.description: The primary aim for our users functionality is to allow you to quickly retrieve and add users to CometChat.

Users/User management.title: User management
Users/User management.description: When a user logs into your app, you need to programmatically login the user into CometChat. But before you log in the user to CometChat, you need to create the user.
